snippet: Ukraine’s acting president on Wednesday conceded what had long been obvious: The government’s police and security officials had lost control in the areas surrounding the cities of Donetsk and Luhansk.
abstract: Ukraine's acting Pres Oleksandr V Turchynov concedes loss of control in areas surrounding eastern cities Donetsk and Luhansk, where pro-Russian forces have defied all efforts by central government to re-establish its authority; few thousand pro-Russian militants have seized buildings in about a dozen cities, effectively establishing control over much of an industrial region of about 6.5 million nestled against Russian border.

byline.original: By ALISON SMALE and ANDREW ROTH
byline.contributor: Alison Smale reported from Kiev, and Andrew Roth from Donetsk, Ukraine. C. J. Chivers and Noah Sneider contributed reporting from Slovyansk, Ukraine, and Peter Baker from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Ukraine’s acting president on Wednesday conceded what had long been obvious: The government’s police and security officials had lost control in the areas surrounding the cities of Donetsk and Luhansk.

headline.main: Ukraine Says That Militants Won the East
headline.print_headline: Ukraine Says That Militants Won the East
